Newbie Guide:
The Newbie Travel Token is reserved for players of level 20 or below.
It allows the player to move to the start town of another tribe via the Newbie Guides in each town.
Be cautious, for in many cases, you may learn and practice certain skills and quests that are unique to the town of each tribe.
Once a player reaches level 20, he is no longer able to teleport using the Newbie Travel Token.

Newbie Guide:
AOne-Handed Blunt Weaponhas a higher accuracy than other weapons, but a low Critical Rate. Blunt Weapons are designed to reliably cause a lot of damage. I recommend them for hunters, for example.
As you advance, you can acquire skills specifically for Blunt Weapons. Something to keep in mind about these weapons is that they have greader damage range than other weapon types. They may not be particularly attractive, but they are sturdy, reliable weapons.
Back.

Newbie Guide:
ATwo-Handed Sword or Two-Handed Blunt Weapon possesses both formidable power and reach compared to their one-handed counterparts. That power comes at the price of quickness, however.
The weapons are a good choice for these who rely on inflicting devasting damage in combat. But if you wish to purchase them, you'd better raise your level and save your money! Of course, the differences specified between the One-Handed Sword and the One-Handed Blunt Weapon apply to the two-handed versions as well.
Back.

Newbie Guide:
If you have hunted well, you can equip yourself with good armor. Otherwise, you will have to upgrade gradually. Once you've reached level 6, you can wear Apprentice's Shoes, Cloth Caps and Short Gloves with your armor.
If you are particularty lucky, you may acquire a full set of leather armors. SOme warriors think a wapon is more important than armor, so they only focus on buying weapons. But I think it is better to systematically upgrade both weapons and armor.
Finally, I'll tell you about a Shield. While it certainly can reduce the damage you take, it will slow you down and isn't suitable for some missions. If you have a job that requires that you wear heavy armor, a shield is necessary. For other jobs for which a Dagger and light armor are better, a Shield will only be a burden
Back.

Newbie Guide:
From now on, you must pay more attention! Listen to me carefully: the most important thing for you to have is the will to seek adventure in the depest parts of the Isle of Souls. Follow that will and you may feel yourself already becoming a stronger Kamael.
Ah, one last thing! When you reach level 10, visit Hierarch Kekropus and he will tell you of the test you must take to become a true Kameal warrior.
Back

Newbie Guide:
At that level, you can fight the Green Goblin and Hill Werewolves. If you are skilled at hunting, you can also fight the Muertos Archer or Mountain Fungus.
You can find them at the center of the island, south of the town. It is called the Hills of Gold. You can find there every monster that I've mentioned. Before going there, though, visit Captain Zerstorer Marcela. If you catch a monster on Hills of Gold, he will reward you. I don't know what you're doing know. but it will benefit you.
By the way, be careful of the Muertos who are wandering around Hills of Gold -- they are no easy target, whatever their appearance. Fight them only after you have reached level 11.
Back

Newbie Guide:
When you reach level 10, visit Hierarch Kekropus. He will supervies a ceremony which is necessary for you to become a true Kamael warrior.
You should also meet Zerstorer Marcela, whom you can find at the town entrance. He has been troubled by the increasing number of monsters on Hills of Gold and may want your help to get rid of the monsters.
Back

Newbie Guide:
At this level, if you prefer to use a speceific attack skill, train hard to enhance that skill. Upgrade the ones you already use most when you become level 10.
As a rule, novices acquire an attack skill first and only later learn support skills. Therefore, it may be helpful to learn passive skills like Weapon Mastery, Armor Mastery, Magic Immunity or Soul Mastery. I also recommend that you learn Rapid Attack, which temporarily enhances your attack power.
Back

Newbie Guide:
The One-Handed Swordis the most basic weapon in the game, prossessing balanced attributes. The Squire's Sword you began your adventures with was one of these. Unless you prefer a specific weapon. I recommend staying with a One-Handed Sword.
You can also use Fallen Atack with it, which will allow you to strike a critical blow to enemies.
Back.

Newbie Guide:
Bow is its ability to deliver damage at range. It is the slowest weapon, but can also infliict the greatest damage, making it ideal for support in combat. If you master the bow, however, it is possible to use it as your primary weapon.
In addition, a bow can use a magical skill called Fallen Arrow. All in all, it is a highly useful and versatile weapon.
Back.

Newbie Guide:
Which weapon do you use now? What kind of weapon do you want to use in the future? The reason why I'm asking this question is that it is important that you find the most suitable weapon for you when you reach level 6
If you think that a Dagger is the best fit, buy a Bone Dagger. If you have enough money, you can also buy a Doom Dagger, but a Bone Dagger should be good enough. If you prefer a Sword, buy a Short Sword. If you have enough money, you can also buy a Broad Sword, but a Short Sword should be good enough. If you want to use a blunt weapon rather than a knife, I recommend a Club. A blunt weapon has a higher accuracy rate than other weapons. A Lance, meanwhile, can be used to attack serveral enemies at once, while a Bow is ideal for remote attack.
No matter which weapon you use, though, don't forget this: you can use the Kamael's unique weapon after reaching level 20 and completing the first class transfer. If you are a Kamael male, you must be familiar with the Two-Handed Sword and the One-Handed Sword. If you are a Kamael female, you should be familiar with the One-Handed Sword and the Bow.
You will have enough money to buy the next weapon once you reach level 9 or 10. But you'd better wait a while. As I mentioned if you take the test given by Hierarch Kekropus, he will give you a weapon.
"I'd like to know the characteristics of each weapon."
"I'd like to know about armor."
Back.

Newbie Guide:
ADagger allows you to attack with unsurpassed speed, as well as the greatest chance of inflicting critical damage. However, its accuracy is low, its reach is quite short and even its critical damage is low compared to other weapons on the same level. A Dagger also has a very small range of random damage
Back.
